svg.text: • Hybrid PoS/PoW – the finality gadget – may be in the Constantinople fork .
• Jon Choi: Casper 101 . Seems more like an upper level than a 101, but lots of resources to learn
• Yoichi: Implementing a vault in Bamboo and what Yoichi is spending time on
• Runtime Verification to work with UIUC on formally verifying Viper using K
• Nick Johnson’s SHA1 implementation in Solidity
• The code for the Colony token sale that wasn’t
• Test your Solidity code with Javascript
• Azure ERC-20 Token Service on Quorum
• Spificator : notifications UI for your dapp’s users
• Vote in CoinDesk’s Most Influential People in Blockchain . You don’t need an email address to vote,
it takes 2 minutes, and I don’t want to lose in my category to Paris Hilton. So please vote?
• Hardware wallet vulnerabilities analysis from Karl Kreder
• Simon de la Rouviere: Continuous Token-Curated Registries
• Ethereal Summit in San Francisco on October 27. Use discount code WeekInETH for $100 off. I’ll be
• Pelle from Uport: Adventures in “Decentralized” Push Notifications
• On MyEtherWallet, gas price can now be adjusted by 0.1 gwei instead of 1 gwei
• Technical details of what Ujo is doing with the Giraffage release
• LocalEthereum does 100 trades in its first 2 days
• Metronome : a new currency on Ethereum with the hopes of taking it elsewhere. by Jeff Garzik.
• LunarToken : buy land on the moon. “how smart contracts could be used to manage real estate”
• CryptoCribs : AirBnB using Ether as payment method, eventually decentralized AirBnB
• ERC Dex : another dex built on 0x
• Q&A with Simon de la Rouviere on Ujo and Curation Markets
• Video interview of Hudson Jameson intro to blockchain
• Matthew Spoke conference talk on Aion
• 6 min of Ujo and RAC talking about revolutionizing the music industry
• Evan Van Ness (yup, that’s me!): There’s no such thing as “fat protocols”
• Jordan Daniell writes up Vitalik’s comments on tokens at EthWaterloo
• Brendan Bernstein: Structuring Optimal Token Sales
• Don’t get those tokens unless the tokens need you by Yoichi Hirai
• Ben Evans: the scale of tech winners . If scale continues to increase, perhaps some seemingly absurd
valuations are more rational than appears.
• Vitalik Buterin: On Medium-of-Exchange Token Valuations
• Karl Kreder from Grid+ on Epicenter
Karl Kreder from Grid+ on Epicenter
• How to participate in the Mercury Protocol sale
How to participate in the Mercury Protocol sale
• Coinlist – the offshoot of FileCoin and Angelist.
• EtherDelta injection attack hacker wasted over $75k trying to enter AirSwap sale
• Google unveils advanced protection , an upgraded 2fa.
• Video tutorial: support the Ethereum Community with Brave Payments
• Don’t give money to phishers: beware of infested ENS names using ZeroWidthCharacter (and Reddit
WARNING : list may include or even likely includes scams and quasi-scams . Do your own research and
due diligence before putting value at risk. Read disclaimer below.
Want to be included? If you are building your project on Ethereum, email weekinethereum @ gmail
[period] com with 1) your URL, 2) sale date and 3) a brief but convincing description of how you are
using Ethereum, preferably with a link to your Github repo. Listings are free . But please make sure
to follow those instructions . If you don’t follow the instructions, you likely won’t get a response.
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as to even whether
they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether any will produce a satisfactory
return. I have passed the CFA exams , but this is not investment advice. If you’re interested in what
I do, you can find my somewhat out-of-date investing thesis and token sale appreciation strategies in
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
I’m thankful that ConsenSys has brought me on as an employee and given me time to do this newsletter.
My charge from Joe Lubin is pretty similar to what Status has told me: keep telling the truth and
covering the space as objectively as I can.
Editorial control is 100% me. Blame me first and last.
Thanks for reading. Every week I put an amount of time into this newsletter that even I can hardly
believe, so many thanks for making it worthwhile.
I’d love it if you shared this newsletter.
This newsletter is supported by Status.im and ConsenSys (have you seen that we’re hiring ?). Many
